project.name: Orion Edge Gateway
project.scope: API gateway, rate limiting, auth integration

sections.title: Project Overview & Objectives
sections.goal: Elicit a clear understanding of the Orion Edge Gateway project objectives, scope boundaries, and alignment with company mission and values.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through the primary objectives of the Orion Edge Gateway initiative?
How does the scope of the project align with Novereon Systems' mission of cloud-native data and platform engineering for regulated industries?
What are the key success criteria or KPIs you have established for this build phase?

sections.title: Stakeholder Management & SLA Alignment
sections.goal: Understand how SLA-ORI-02 and other service expectations are communicated and agreed upon with stakeholders.
sample_questions: How have you communicated the p95 latency < 120ms target to both technical and business stakeholders?
Could you describe any conflicts or tradeoffs that emerged between stakeholder expectations and SLA commitments?
What escalation paths exist if SLA thresholds are at risk during build or early operation?

sections.title: Risk Identification & Mitigation
sections.goal: Explore the risk landscape, including technical, operational, and compliance risks, and how they are mitigated.
sample_questions: What are the top three risks you’ve identified for the Orion Edge Gateway build phase?
How are these risks tracked and reported—do you use specific runbooks or ticketing conventions?
Can you provide an example of a risk that was mitigated through a change in scope or timeline?

sections.title: Integration with Other Systems
sections.goal: Investigate how Orion Edge Gateway integrates with other portfolio projects, such as Aegis IAM or Nimbus Observability.
sample_questions: Which upstream or downstream systems does Orion Edge Gateway directly interface with?
How have you coordinated with the Aegis IAM team for auth integration?
What monitoring or observability hooks are planned in collaboration with Nimbus Observability?

sections.title: Operational Readiness & Handover
sections.goal: Assess preparations for transition from build to operate, including documentation, training, and incident response alignment.
sample_questions: What is your plan for validating the RB-GW-011 rolling deployment runbook before go-live?
How will you ensure the operations team is trained and ready to handle incidents like GW-4821?
Are there any gaps in the current operational readiness checklist that you’re working to close?

sections.title: Decision Log & Tradeoffs
sections.goal: Review major decisions taken during the build phase, the tradeoffs considered, and evidence used to support them.
sample_questions: Can you share a recent decision where you had to balance latency targets against feature completeness?
What documentation or RFCs did you reference to make that decision?
How do you record and communicate these tradeoffs to ensure transparency?
